page.title: Reactions
page.introduction:
Reactions define the stoichiometry and kinetics of the BioModel. They consist of species (variables) and kinetic laws for reactions or membrane fluxes. Reactions act on species within an individual or membrane structure, or between a volume and adjacent membrane. Membrane Fluxes occur within membrane structures and act on species of the neighboring volumes. (e.g. channels and pumps.
Create, view and edit reactions and membrane fluxes using either the tabular or the diagrammatic views. Properties for reactions and fluxes an be found in the Reactions properties pane or Membrane Flux properties pane in the bottom of the window.
